DELETE.ARE_YOU_SURE: Are you sure that you want to delete '{label}'? This action cannot be undone.

WARNINGS.DUPLICATE_ID: A bonus with that identifier already exists!
WARNINGS.MISSING_TARGET: You must designate where the bonus should apply!
WARNINGS.MISSING_ITEM_TYPES: You must select at least one item type!
WARNINGS.MISSING_ABILITY_TYPES: You must select at least one ability!
WARNINGS.MISSING_FILTER: Your bonus needs at least one filter!
WARNINGS.MISSING_THROW_TYPES: You must select at least one type of saving throw!

TOOLTIPS.TOGGLE_THIS: Toggle this bonus on or off. A bonus that is toggled off will be completely ignored, even if it is an aura.
TOOLTIPS.COPY_THIS: Copy this bonus into the builder. This clears all fields before adding all data from this bonus.
TOOLTIPS.EDIT_THIS: Edit this bonus in the builder. This clears all fields before adding all the data from this bonus.
TOOLTIPS.DELETE_THIS: Delete this bonus from this document. Deletion is permanent and the bonus cannot be recovered.
TOOLTIPS.ADD_THIS_FILTER: Add this filter to the builder.
TOOLTIPS.DELETE_THIS_FILTER: Remove this filter from the builder.
TOOLTIPS.IDENTIFIERS: Identifying information of the bonus. The label is for your convenience, while the identifier is used to refer to the bonus internally and can only contain hyphens and lowercase letters.
TOOLTIPS.DESCRIPTION: A description of the bonus for your convenience.

ATTACK.BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the attack roll such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
ATTACK.CRIT_RANGE: An integer to subtract from the critical range of the attack roll. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.
ATTACK.FUMBLE_RANGE: An integer to add to the fumble range of the attack roll. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.

DAMAGE.BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the damage roll such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
DAMAGE.CRIT_DICE: An additional number of dice that should be rolled on a critical hit. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.
DAMAGE.CRIT_DMG: Additional parts to add on top of the damage roll on critical hits such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.

SAVE.BONUS: An integer to add onto the DC of a saving throw. This field respects roll data properties, such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.

THROW.BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the saving throw such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.
THROW.DEATH_TARGET: An integer to subtract from the minimum requirement to pass a death saving throw. This field respects roll data properties such as @abilities.int.mod, but not dice rolls such as 1d4.

HITDIE.BONUS: Additional parts to add on top of the hit die roll such as 1d4 or @scale.rogue.sneak-attack.

TOOLTIPS.arbitraryComparison: Insert numbers, roll data properties, strings, or a combination of the three, that must be in a specific relationship for the bonus to apply. This comparison can evaluate substrings by using either of the inequalities. You can also use roll data from a targeted token's actor by prepending with @target.
TOOLTIPS.itemRequirements: Toggle whether the item should require being equipped or attuned to for the bonus or aura to be in effect.
TOOLTIPS.itemTypes: The types of items the bonus should apply to. For example if the item should only apply to spells or only to weapons.
TOOLTIPS.throwTypes: The type of saving throw the bonus should apply to. This also applies to death saving throws, and you can adjust the target value of death saves as well.
TOOLTIPS.damageTypes: The type of damage the item must deal for the bonus to apply. For example if a spell deals fire damage.
TOOLTIPS.abilities: The ability score used by the item. This respects items set to use defaults, such as spells using the spellcasting ability, or finesse weapons using either Strength or Dexterity.
TOOLTIPS.statusEffects: The conditions the actor must be affected by. For example blind;charm will mean you only get this bonus while either blinded or charmed. The module looks for Status Ids in the effects.
TOOLTIPS.targetEffects: The conditions the target actor must be affected by. For example blind;charm will mean you only get this bonus while your target is either blinded or charmed. The module looks for Status Ids in the effects.
TOOLTIPS.attackTypes: The type of attack roll the item must have for the bonus to apply. For example if you cast a spell that involves a ranged spell attack.
TOOLTIPS.saveAbilities: The ability that must be used to set the saving throw DC of the item for the bonus to apply; for example a Battle Master fighter who determines their Maneuver DC with Dexterity. This can be different from the ability the item otherwise uses. If an item is set to scale with Spellcasting, the actor's spellcasting ability is compared against.
TOOLTIPS.spellComponents: The components or spell tags the spell must have for the bonus to apply. You can choose whether the spell must have all of the given components or tags, or at least one of them. For example if you want a bonus to apply to all spells that require concentration.
TOOLTIPS.spellLevels: The level at which the spell must be cast for the bonus to apply. You can select each level individually. For example, you can have a bonus apply only to cantrips, only to leveled spells, or only to spells of 3rd level or below.
TOOLTIPS.spellSchools: The school the spell must belong to for the bonus to apply. If multiple schools are selected, the spell must belong to any one of them. For example, if you want a bonus to apply only to Divination spells.
TOOLTIPS.baseWeapons: The type of weapon the item must be for the bonus to apply. For example Battleaxe, Shortbow, or Longsword.
TOOLTIPS.weaponProperties: The weapon properties the item either must have or cannot have for the bonus to apply. If any are selected, the weapon must have at least one of the needed properties, and none of the unfit properties. For example if you want a bonus to apply only to Two-Handed weapons.
TOOLTIPS.AURA: Whether this bonus should transfer to other token actors on a scene. A bonus transferred to another actor will still be evaluated against the filters below, acting as if the actor attempting to benefit from the aura was the owner of the bonus in the first place.
TOOLTIPS.AURA_RANGE: The range of the aura, measured in feet (put in -1 for an unlimited range), and if the aura affects the area within a Measured Template instead (for items that are able to place a template).
TOOLTIPS.AURA_TEMPLATE: Whether this aura affects token actors within the area of a Measured Template, rather than token actors within a range of this item's owner.
TOOLTIPS.AURA_FIELDS: Which targets should benefit from the aura, and whether the aura should affect its owner as well. Allies are defined as tokens that have the same disposition as the owner; enemies are those with a Hostile disposition (if you are Friendly) or Friendly disposition (if you are Hostile).
TOOLTIPS.AURA_BLOCKERS: The status conditions that block an aura from being transferred, such as a paladin's aura that is only active while the paladin is neither dead nor unconscious. This has no effect if the aura is on a Measured Template.
TOOLTIPS.AURA_SELF: Whether this aura should affect its owner as well.

throwTypes.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available for bonuses applying to saving throws.

itemTypes.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available for bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs.

itemRequirements.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available for bonuses originating from items that can be equipped or attuned to.

attackTypes.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available for bonuses applying to attack rolls or damage rolls.

damageTypes.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available for bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs.

abilities.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available for bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs.

saveAbilities.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available for bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs.

spellComponents.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs, and only if 'spell' is selected as one of the Item Types.

spellLevels.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs, and only if 'spell' is selected as one of the Item Types.

spellSchools.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs, and only if 'spell' is selected as one of the Item Types.

baseWeapons.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs, and only if 'weapon' is selected as one of the Item Types.

weaponProperties.REQUIREMENTS: This filter is only available bonuses applying to attack rolls, damage rolls, and save DCs, and only if 'weapon' is selected as one of the Item Types.

KEY.ITEM_TYPES_DESC: Select any item type that this bonus should apply to. You must select at least one.
KEY.ABILITIES_DESC: Select the ability score that is used by the item. This filter respects spellcasting abilities, finesse weapons, and default values.
KEY.SAVE_ABILITIES_DESC: Select the ability score that is used by the item to set the saving throw's DC. This filter respects spellcasting abilities.
KEY.ATTACK_TYPES_DESC: Select the type of attack the item must have for the bonus to apply.
KEY.DAMAGE_TYPES_DESC: Select a damage type. If the item has a formula with at least one of the selected damage types, the bonus will apply.
KEY.COMPONENTS_DESC: Select any spell component that the item must have. You can choose whether the spell must have all or at least one of the selected options.
KEY.SPELL_LEVELS_DESC: Select the spell levels that the bonus should apply to. This is the level at which the spell was cast, not the base level.
KEY.SPELL_SCHOOLS_DESC: Select the spell schools that the spell must be a member of.
KEY.ACTOR_CONDITIONS_DESC: Select the status conditions that the actor must be afflicted by. The bonus will apply if the actor is afflicted by at least one of the selected conditions.
KEY.TARGET_CONDITIONS_DESC: Select the status conditions that the target actor must be afflicted by. The bonus will apply if the target actor is afflicted by at least one of the selected conditions.
KEY.WEAPONS_DESC: Select the type of weapons that the bonus should apply to.
KEY.PROPERTIES_DESC: Select weapon properties that should be required for the weapon (the bonus will apply if the weapon has at least one of them) or any properties that must not appear on the weapon.
KEY.THROW_TYPES_DESC: Select the types of saving throws the bonus should apply to.
KEY.AURA_BLOCKERS_DESC: Select the status conditions that will prevent the benefits of the aura from being transferred to the actor and other actors.

TRAITS.NAME: Build-a-Bonus Workshop
TRAITS.HINT: Open the Build-a-Bonus workshop. Here you can create situational bonuses that should apply automatically for various rolls, such as saving throws, damage rolls, and hit die rolls.
TRAITS.LABEL: Build-a-Bonus Workshop

DISPLAY_LABEL.NAME: Display Label
DISPLAY_LABEL.HINT: If checked, the label is displayed in the header of applicable items and effects.
